TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1054
TEI.2.document_title: Thomas Darle to Stephen F. Austin, 03-05-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: Thomas Earle to Austin, March 5, 1825. Concerning land.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1054

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Thomas Earle to Austin, March 5, 1825. Concerning land.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Buflou Byou*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="03-05-1825">March 5th 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Sir*/p*
*p*I understand you grant, Lebours to men of *person_mentioned*fameleys*/person_mentioned* on these *location_mentioned*waters*/location_mentioned* I in Consequince of not, haveing no timber *location_mentioned*on my League*/location_mentioned* I hope, Sir, you will grant me *location_mentioned*timber Land */location_mentioned*on *location_mentioned*greens Byoue*/location_mentioned*, I would do myself the honour to Call and See you but Expecting the arivl of the Schooner daley *person_mentioned*James Early my Son*/person_mentioned* a young man Groing hopes you will grant, him Land the Same as other young men, Should you think proper Sir to grant, me any you will please Sir to give the order for Survey to *person_mentioned*Mr. Cook*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Sir, *person_mentioned*Alexander Kelpatrick*/person_mentioned* mate of my Schooner requested of me to aply to you for Land on these waters he being continneley on board provents him Seeing to his business, and now at See*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Thos Earle*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
